go_data.justification: IGF-1 appears to be able to improve the condition of muscle disuse through the regulation of protein synthesis.
IGF-1 overexpression or chronic treatment can favor muscle hypertrophy.
IGF-1 overexpression has been shown to have limited effects in preventing HU-induced muscle atrophy, indicating a role in muscle cell proliferation.
Localized infusion of IGF-1 results in skeletal muscle hypertrophy, indicating IGF-1 is secreted into the extracellular space.
